div.p: Re the notice in the Argus of Saturday last in regard to letters of the late Sir Baldwin, I am forwarding a copy of a letter in my possession which may have some interest in connection with the past friendship of your husband with Baron von Mueller.

I may explain that I wrote a memoir of the Life of the Baron in the year 1824
1924. , and on reading a copy of the same Sir Baldwin sent me the letter of which a copy is enclosed.
See M. Spencer to C. Daley, 23 January 1925.

About 3 months before he left Australia, he asked me to come and see him at the office at the Museum, and he asked me on that occasion if I would prepare and publish a more complete and pretentious biography of the Baron. He said that he would give me every assistance in doing so in supplementing the work, and, after a long conversation on the subject asked me to consider the matter well, and see him again about it.

As it happened I came upon some very important letters of Sir Wm. and Sir Jos. Hooker, and Mr Bentham to Baron Mueller extending over a period of forty years, and dealing with the genesis and the publication of Bentham's Classical work, "Flora Australiensis", which he was able to bring to a successful completion, through the collaboration of von Mueller.

These letters I used in the production of a brochure, "History of Flora Australiensis", which appeared in a succession of articles in the Victorian Naturalist." and could have been used to great advantage in publishing the larger work as suggested by your husband.
I had hoped to talk the matter over with him on his return;- which was not to be, and I do not think now that I shall undertake it.

I fully appreciated the kindly interest and the offer of assistance rendered by Sir Baldwin for whose great talents and outstanding public service in so many departments: Civic as well as scientific, I had a very sincere admiration.
Trusting that the letter may have some value in connection with the days of long ago,
